p: FSCAV limits ( Fig 1a), correspond to the ad-hoc voltages (0.4 V and 0.9 V) selected as integration limits for the quantification of dopamine [ 13]. Note that all measurements were collected using a traditional FSCV waveform described in section 2.2 as opposed to FSCAV. Inflection limits are defined as the zeros of the second derivative of a voltammogram, around an oxidation (or reduction) peak, and curvature points (maximum curvature, or maximum second derivative) are defined as the maxima/minima of the second derivative around an oxidation/reduction peak, see Fig 1(b).
